question: Which smart-phone maker launched the first 5G-enabled smartphone of India?
explanation:
The Chinese smart-phone manufacturer Realme recently introduced India’s first 5G-enabled smartphone, which is named as ‘Realme X50 Pro’.
The flagship smartphone was also simultaneously launched in Spain. The phone can switch to 5G when is outside India via \'Smart 5G\', as 5G is not completely available in India, yet. It can be still used in 4G mode, till it is introduced.
